edu.cornell.gdiac.util

Class JsonAssetManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager
      • edu.cornell.gdiac.util.JsonAssetManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable

    public class JsonAssetManager
extends com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager
    An asset manager that uses a JSON file to define its assets. The manager allows assets to be loaded normally, but it is best to use the asset directory methods instead. This means using getEntry() instead of get() to access an asset. This class is implemented as a singleton in order to allow easy access from anywhere in the application. This makes sense when there is only one directory to load. If you want to load a new directory in the middle of the game, you may need to rethink this design.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static JsonAssetManager getInstance()
        Returns a reference to the singleton asset manager If there is no active asset manager, this method will initialize one immediately.
        Returns:
        a reference to the singleton asset manager

      • clearInstance

        public static void clearInstance()
        Clears and disposes the singleton asset manager Calling the method will flush out all assets immediately. This method is preferred to disposing of the manager manually.

      • loadDirectory

        public void loadDirectory(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue json)
        Loads assets defined by the given directory The assets are all loaded asynchronously. The directory will not be loaded if their is a current active directory.
        Parameters:
        json - the parsed asset directory

      • unloadDirectory

        public void unloadDirectory()
        Unloads assets defined in the current directory The asset loader is now free to load another directory.

      • allocateDirectory

        public void allocateDirectory()
        Allocates assets defined in the current directory Assets are allocate after loading. This binds the asset to the directory key to allow key look-up.

      • getEntry

        public <T> T getEntry(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Returns the asset associate with the given directory key The assets must be allocated for this method to return a value.
        Parameters:
        key - the asset directory key
        type - the asset type

        public java.lang.String getKey(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture)

        Parameters:
        texture - Texture to be searched for.
        Returns:
        Key associated with texture; null if not found.
